author: devCheckingIn
body:
Looks like we'll have another Fed board member voting for a rate cut in September; from MarketWatch:

Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari on Wednesday said it may soon be time to lower interest rates.

In an interview with CNBC, Kaskhari said that it might not be known for a year or more if new White House tariffs on trading partners will spark persistent inflationary pressures. At the same time, the data in hand clearly show the economy is slowing.

Ive been a bit of a ðŸ» for a bit now but its only cause i got burned on the last run and know how it feels. To meâ€¦ this one may be winding down all it takes is 1 really bad set of news and weâ€™re reset to another winter. Careful out there and hodl if your a long term.  Just keep stacking.

author: Grunblau
body:
If you have a substantial holding on exchanges, you should consider moving at least 75-80% into your own custody.

This doesnâ€™t necessarily mean a Ledger.  Moving to a self custody wallet keeps players like Coinbase, CDC and Binance from loaning out your holdings to actors that want to suppress the price.

author: VariatCA
body:
We'll see what happens in the next hour or so with this "Yuge Press Conference Announcement" from the White House this afternoon. 

Hopefully it's some good, relieving news for the markets, because the S&P/Nasdaq are only another modest +0.5% away from their ATH that was reached last week. 

If that gets reclaimed confidently, Bitcoin might just *TELEPORT* right back to the 118k range before you can blink!

edit: Looks like the announcement is specific in nature, just another "big investment from a tech company into the U.S.!" conference lol.

author: Sebanimation
body:
Only use official links, check the URL twice, read the trx message carefully before signing and youâ€˜re good to go. 

I think with yoroi you can do it directly in your wallet. Lace is easy too, eternl is currently working on an update for next week.

author: RefrigeratorLow1259
body: It's safe, you are not signing a transaction with the wallet - I used Yoroi wallet to link to the midnight portal, it was done in 5 minutes. You might have probs with Hardware wallets at the moment though, as the signature hash size is too large ; they're  working on a fix at Ledger/Trezor.

author: uncapchad
body: you can open a new wallet because to claim you need an unused Receive address which you must sign for. So first they ask for existing address to calc your reward, then they ask for an unused address which doesn't have to be in the same app/service as long as you can sign for it.  You might have to add 1 ADA to the new one to make the tokens visible. I haven't done mine yet.

author: VariatCA
body:
If you have zero intention of selling anytime soon, you might as well "put it to work" and stake it for a yield. 

The cons are simply having that asset locked up and inaccessible for the staking/unstaking periods, where you would not be able to capitalize on big price movements, and could not limit your losses if something happened to drag the markets down.

body: From what I've read people have been able to use Ledger with Yoroi wallet  - with the other Cardano wallets like Eternl etc, they hash the signature which is too big for Ledger/Trezor to handle , about 250 bytes - Ledger only allows 31...Yoroi doesn't hash so it's good to go.

author: VariatCA
body:
The whole definition of their idea of "burgers always dump" becomes fluid to match their bias. 

Does it simply mean "The U.S. market usually sells for the first hour" and completely disregards buying back throughout the day? Does it mean "There is always a net price-loss during U.S. market hours"?

Whatever the claim may be, I guarantee it's simply swayed by confirmation bias and/or recency-bias. 

It's like people around here used to always sing "Here comes the SUNDAY DUMP!" Yet if you *actually* go back and look at the numbers over the past, say, 3+ months, it was just as likely to finish higher as it was to finish lower on Sundays.
